info.name: PackChat Backend API
info.description: This postman collection and documentation dictates the available endpoints and abilities of the internal PackChat API. Subject to change frequently.

item.name: Authentication

request.description:
This endpoint will create or get a device and either create a new user if one doesn't exists with the exact credentials given OR pass back the existing user ID in the response.

- If a user exists but not with the device ID given, a new device is created and associated to the existing user
- If a device exists but not with the phone number given, a new user is created and associated to the existing device
    

An OTP is generated for the second authentication step. This OTP along with the user uuid and deice uuid should be used in the Login request to authenticate the user.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| device_id | yes | String | Local UUID like ID of the device being used. (Mobiles only) |
| phone_country | yes | string/length:2 | ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code |
| phone | yes | string/international/mobile | e164 formatted mobile number |

response.name: Missing Data Response

request.description:
Use the OTP, Device ID and User ID from the [Upsert Device](https://go.postman.co/workspace/c2d5fe7f-f020-40ea-8aa7-84699618f94b/documentation/1649870-a00614f9-87bd-4207-8637-8503574ea9f9?entity=request-e7c7cd08-a3bc-488e-afd6-3d464a02dae6) in this call to actually authenticate the user and retrieving the bearer token needed to make subsequent API calls.

**THIS POSTMAN REQUEST IS SET UP TO AUTOMATICALLY RUN THE DEVICE REQUEST. PLEASE SEE ENVIRONMENT VARIABLES, AND SIMPLY USE THIS REQUEST UNLESS DEBUGGING DEVICE ENDPOINT**

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| device_uuid | yes | string/uuid | Internal UUID for device |
| user_uuid | yes | string/uuid | Internal UUID for user |
| otp | yes | string/length:6 | 6 digit one time password code. Expires after 5 minutes |
Use this endpoint to unauthenticate a users session. This will blacklist any previous token used.

item.description: This section contains API requests need to authenticate and unauthenticate users. PackChat uses a 2 step authentication approach. Firstly a device and user need to be registered and an OTP is generated. Secondly this OTP and other details from the device request should be used to actually authenticate the user.

item.name: User

request.description: Get the currently authenticated user object

Update the currently authenticated users name.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| first_name | yes | string | User first name |
| last_name | yes | string | User last name |

Update the currently authenticated users avatar.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| avatar | yes | file | File to upload |
| _method | yes | PATCH | Laravel methodology for form-data patch requests |

This request updates the users onboarded at timestamp which is the trigger that allows the user to exit the onboarding flow and continue to the app. This request will also associate the users ID with a phone hash in the address table if it exists. It will also automatically accept any pending invites.

response.name: User Already Onboarded Response

request.description: This request will remove the onboarded flag from the user and force them back into onboarding flow. A successful response is `204 no content`

query.description: Can be true or false

request.description: Retrieves all contacts the user is associated with in a friendship. Includes both in pack and not in pack users and filterable by `in_pack`
Retreives a users phone address book. This gets uploaded and synced each time the user is authenticated in the app.

Sync the devices address book to pack chat using hashed versions of phone numbers.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| additions | yes | array | Array of hashed phone numbers to add to a users address book. Hash must match backend API hash. Can be empty. |
| subtractions | yes | array | Array of hashed phone numbers to remove from a users address book. Hash must match backend API hash. Can be empty. |
Create an invite for a non packchat user. The invite has an iitial status of `not_sent` until the interfacing application upddates the status.

variable.description: The ID given back when creating the invite

request.description:
Updates an invite request. Takes the invite id created when using the create invite method and a body paramter of status which can be one of:

- `not_sent` - the invite has been created internally but not sent to the end user
    
- `pending` - The invite has been sent to the end user
    
- `lapsed` - The invite link has timed out
    
- `cancelled` - The invite link has been cancelled
    
- `active` - The invite link has been used and the user is now active in PackChat

response.name: No Status Response

variable.description: The ID given back when creating the invite
The ID given back when creating the invite
The invites ID that was given when created.

request.description: Cancels an invite as long as the invite status hasnt already been set to active.

variable.description: The invites ID that was given when created.
The invites ID that was given when created.

item.description: The user endpoints detail a multitude of functions that are avaliable for users and to detail the user themselves

query.description: Search by the channels name
Filter by the user id to get any channels that user created initially.
Filter channels by if they are a group channel. Can be True or False.

request.description: Gets all chat channels the user is associated with. This holds intermediary information about the channel and the GetStream Channel ID

response.name: Successful Response

query.description: Search by the channels name
Filter by the user id to get any channels that user created initially.
Filter channels by if they are a group channel. Can be True or False.

formdata.description: Can be `all`, `notes` or `pack`. Differentiator for ability to split channels by type in the future
Array of user id's that will be a member of the group. If only one given it will be made a 1-1 chat. You do not need to supplied the currently authorised user id.

request.description: Creates a channel within packchat and GetStream. The users in the members array must exist in both packchat and GetStream if not a valid error message will be returned. When using the members array in form-post data it must be plit out on Postman as you can see here but in JSON payloads a normal array is accepted (Weird Postman behaviour, need to use form data due to the image upload)

formdata.description: Can be `all`, `notes` or `pack`. Differentiator for ability to split channels by type in the future
Array of user id's that will be a member of the group. If only one given it will be made a 1-1 chat. You do not need to supplied the currently authorised user id.
Can be `all`, `notes` or `pack`. Differentiator for ability to split channels by type in the future
Array of user id's that will be a member of the group. If only one given it will be made a 1-1 chat. You do not need to supplied the currently authorised user id.

request.description: Get a channels data
Update a channels name and image. Only for Groups.
Deletes a channel by ID. Also removes the GetStream Channel.

Add a member to a group channel.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| members | yes | array | Array of user ID's to add to the group. Must exist in PackChat DB & GetStream |

variable.description: The Internal user id of the member to delete

request.description: Remove a member from the group chat

variable.description: The Internal user id of the member to delete

request.description:
Add a moderator to a group channel only. This user will have elevated priviledges within the group chat.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| moderators | yes | array | Array of user ID's to add to the group. Must exist in PackChat DB & GetStream |

variable.description: The Internal user id of the member to delete

request.description: Remove a member as a moderator from a group chat

variable.description: The Internal user id of the member to delete

query.description: Filter by when the moments where created. Formatted as 04-09-2023,15-09-2023
Exclude authenticated users moments or user packs moments
Include seen moments. True or False
Get moments of a specific User by ID
Get only video or image moments. `image` or `video`
Filter moments by local_id reference
Filter moments as to whether to owner has been notified that they have been successfully uploaded

request.description: List moments. Multiple filters to drill down to moments that need to be displayed.

response.name: Successful Response

query.description: Filter by when the moments where created. Formatted as 04-09-2023,15-09-2023
Exclude authenticated users moments or user packs moments
Include seen moments. True or False
Get moments of a specific User by ID
Get only video or image moments. `image` or `video`
Filter moments by local_id reference
Filter moments as to whether to owner has been notified that they have been successfully uploaded

request.description: Get a moment based on UUID returned from Get Moments Endpoint

Creates an image moment for the authenticated user. This endpoint is a fasttrack instead of using the progressive upload endpoint of Create Image Moment\` we can instead use this endpoint to create and upload an image moment in one request. This could potentially be app blocking if the image is large.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| type | yes | string | Must be `image` |
| timestamp | yes | date-time | The timestamp from when the image/moment was actually taken |
| caption | no | string | Caption for the moment |
| local_id | yes | string/uuid | Local system id for the asset. |
| file | yes | file | Image file for the moment |

response.name: Successful Response
response.body:

request.description:
Creates an image moment for the authenticated user. All moments created start in the pending state until an actual media item is uploaded and associated to it. See Moment Image Chunk Upload endpoint.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| type | yes | string | Must be `image` |
| timestamp | yes | date-time | The timestamp from when the image/moment was actually taken |
| caption | no | string | Caption for the moment |
| local_id | yes | string/uuid | Local system id for the asset. |

response.name: Successful Response

request.description:
Creates an video moment for the authenticated user. All moments created start in the pending state until an actual media item is uploaded and associated to it. This endpoint returns a mux uploadable endpoint to send the video to.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| type | yes | string | Must be `video` |
| timestamp | yes | date-time | The timestamp from when the image/moment was actually taken |
| caption | no | string | Caption for the moment |
| local_id | yes | string/uuid | Local system id for the asset. |
| file | no | file | File used for placeholder instead of video file |

response.name: Successful Response
response.body:

request.description: Returns a signing key to access a videos playback. Must be called whilst initiating a video from Mux.

query.description: Filter by when the moments where created. Formatted as 04-09-2023,15-09-2023
Exclude authenticated users moments or user packs moments
Include seen moments. True or False
Get moments of a specific User by ID
Get only video or image moments. `image` or `video`
Filter moments by local_id reference
Filter moments as to whether to owner has been notified that they have been successfully uploaded

request.description: Returns an alternative moments listing based on the first moment of a day. Gives the first moment of a day for all dates defined by filters.

response.name: Successful Response

query.description: Filter by when the moments where created. Formatted as 04-09-2023,15-09-2023
Exclude authenticated users moments or user packs moments
Include seen moments. True or False
Get moments of a specific User by ID
Get only video or image moments. `image` or `video`
Filter moments by local_id reference
Filter moments as to whether to owner has been notified that they have been successfully uploaded

request.description: REturns the current state for the authenticated user on their moments usage from the last three wekks.
WIP - Upload image chunks to a specific moment. Run the Create Image Moment endpoint first to obtain a fresh moment model and uuid.

Marks multiple moments as viewed by ther authenticated user. Can acceept single moment ID's or be used for bulk views/skips.

The intention of this API is to send and forget.

Adds an emoji reaction to the moment. Use standard unicode string emojis. This returns a user specific state for that given moment. See Get Moment State endpoint.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| emoji | yes | string | Unicode string emoji format |

Stores a users reply message id and snippet on the moment. This returns a user specific state for that given moment. See Get Moment State endpoint.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| message_id | yes | string/uuid | Message ID from GetStream |
| body | yes | string | Snippet of message for previews |
Gets a moments interatvie state. Gives a list of records of specific user interations with the moment e.g. reactions & replies.
Set the authenticated user as to having seen the given user uuids moments
Get a list of moments that the authenticated user hasnt seen and needs to catch up on.

variable.description: The internal ID of the media item

request.description: This request is only to be used when necessary for when a normal signed URL directly from the backend isn't viable. The only current example of this is when a user signs up and we create their GetStream profile, we uplaod an image for them. Due to this being a stored string in a third party application, any signed URL will expire leaving 404 Not Found urls. By storing the media item id/url on GetStream we can call this API endpoint and securely retrieve a signed URL.
Get a list of members in your pack

Add a PackChat user to your pack.

| Parameter | Required | Validation | Description |
| --- | --- | --- | --- |
| members | yes | array | An array of PackChat user ids to add to the pack. |
Remove a user from your pack.
Get a list of users where the currently authenticated user is a part of their pack.
